meanings.definition: A joint made by beveling each of two parts to be joined, usually at a 45-degree angle, to form a corner, usually a 90-degree angle.
meanings.sent1: The carpenter carefully cut the miters on the wooden frame for a perfect fit.
meanings.sent2: She used miters to connect the pieces of the puzzle together.
meanings.sent3: The playful kitten tried to play hide and seek in the miters of the furniture.
meanings.sent4: His words and actions seemed to fit together like perfectly aligned miters.
meanings.sent5: The artist's attention to detail in creating the miters made the artwork stand out.

meanings.definition: A headdress in the shape of a tall pointed hat, worn by bishops and senior clergy in many Western Christian denominations.
meanings.sent1: The bishop wore a majestic miter during the religious ceremony.
meanings.sent2: The intricate design of the miter symbolized the bishop's authority.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous squirrel tried to climb the tall miter hanging on the wall.
meanings.sent4: The miter atop the bishop's head seemed to reach for the heavens.
meanings.sent5: The shimmering jewels on the miter sparkled under the church's lights.
